meanings.definition: To shock or greatly surprise someone
meanings.sent1: The loud noise seemed to stun the little girl.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news will stun everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to stun the audience with a disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset can stun you into silence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise seemed to stun the shy student.

meanings.definition: To render someone unconscious or dazed
meanings.sent1: The boxer's powerful punch could stun his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The blow to the head might stun the player for a moment.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character got hit on the head and was stunned for a while.
meanings.sent4: The bright light can stun insects flying around.
meanings.sent5: The medicine was so strong that it could stun the patient during surgery.

meanings.sent1: The magician's trick never fails to stun the audience.
meanings.sent2: The grand fireworks display will stun the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected win seemed to stun the underdog team.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop can stun hikers.
meanings.sent5: The incredible talent of the young singer will stun the judges.
